body:
has to be python 3.6 or up - check and see what `python3` is on wsl (it may be 3.5 by default and you may need to explicitly install python 3.6->3.8 and if they don't seem to exist, look into the deadsnakes PPA and get a more modern one)

`python3 --version` should tell you whatup
@daxpryce looks like it happens with 3.10 as well
It should for 3.10 - it's not being built for 3.10 yet.  I'm working on that, but it isn't ready just yet :)

https://pypi.org/project/graspologic-native/#files

Please verify if this fixes it, and if so, close as fixed :)

@daxpryce maybe? now I'm getting all sorts of other fun issues with `pip install -e .` on `3.10.0`... I'm gonna do battle with it for a bit and see if I can figure out whether this is a my computer thing or a graspologic thing. I also had to `pip install cython` and `pip install numpy` manually, I was getting 'version not found' errors for both of them when I tried to install graspologic directly.

picture above comes along with a whole bunch of fun error messages: UPDATE: there are problems with other packages, so it might just be that I screwed up a bunch of installation things on my computer today.. I'll make another comment when I get this mess sorted out

> @daxpryce maybe? now I'm getting all sorts of other fun issues with `pip install -e .` on `3.10.0`... > > I'm gonna do battle with it for a bit and see if I can figure out whether this is a my computer thing or a graspologic thing. I also had to `pip install cython` and `pip install numpy` manually, I was getting 'version not found' errors for both of them when I tried to install graspologic directly. So yes, this fixes the graspologic-native issues. We should create another ticket for ensuring we have a clean path for 3.10 for graspologic though. Can you create that ticket and add your screenshots there? We can also enable 3.10 in our build matrix on a branch and see what our github runners are saying across all 3 OSes so we can collect all of our problems at once :)

> > @daxpryce maybe? now I'm getting all sorts of other fun issues with `pip install -e .` on `3.10.0`... > > I'm gonna do battle with it for a bit and see if I can figure out whether this is a my computer thing or a graspologic thing. I also had to `pip install cython` and `pip install numpy` manually, I was getting 'version not found' errors for both of them when I tried to install graspologic directly. > > So yes, this fixes the graspologic-native issues. We should create another ticket for ensuring we have a clean path for 3.10 for graspologic though. Can you create that ticket and add your screenshots there? We can also enable 3.10 in our build matrix on a branch and see what our github runners are saying across all 3 OSes so we can collect all of our problems at once :) will do!

issue.title: Ensure clean python 3.10.0 build path
issue.body: I'm having issues installing graspologic on 3.10.0 right now (see fun screenshot). This may or may not be local to my computer. In any case, we should ensure we have a viable build path for graspologic on 3.10.0. See @daxpryce's advice here: > We can also enable 3.10 in our build matrix on a branch and see what our github runners are saying across all 3 OSes so we can collect all of our problems at once :)
